results.name: Variant on Lucas numbers: a(n) = a(n-1) + 3*a(n-2) with a(0)=2 and a(1)=1.
comment: The sequence 4,1,7,.. = 2*0^n+A075118(n) is given by trace(A^n) where A=[1,1,1,1;1,0,0,0;1,0,0,0;1,0,0,0]. - _Paul Barry_, Oct 01 2004
For n>2, a(n) is the numerator of the value of the continued fraction 1+3/(1+3/(1+...+3/7)) where there are n-2 1's. - _Alexander Mark_, Aug 16 2020
reference: Thomas Koshy, "Fibonacci and Lucas Numbers with Applications", Wiley, 2001, p. 471.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,3).
formula: a(n) = [x^n] ( (1 + x + sqrt(1 + 2*x + 13*x^2))/2 )^n for n >= 1. - _Peter Bala_, Jun 23 2015
program: (Sage) [lucas_number2(n,1,-3) for n in range(0, 30)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 30 2009
(MAGMA) I:=[2,1]; [n le 2 select I[n] else Self(n-1)+3*Self(n-2): n in [1..40]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 20 2013
(GAP) a:=[2,1];; for n in [3..40] do a[n]:=a[n-1]+3*a[n-2]; od; a; # _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 15 2020
